data.title: Nice place for breakfast
data.text:
Most time we have a great meal here. In 5 yrs have had only 1 really bad experience. 
My mother's chicken fried steak tasted like freazer burn and my porkchops were over cooked and had a long dark hair in it! Was given only a 10% discount for all of this. So my mother and I now only order breakfast items.

data.title: Good Old Style Food
data.text: We came back recently after having not been for awhile. This is a charming old fashioned diner type place. The steak & eggs is excellent. You could use a little help with your landscape esp. out front, it would look better and cleaner even if it was just rocks. Maybe you should try to make it match your mural inside.

data.title: I HAVEN'T BEEN THERE IN AGES! BUT I'LL GO BACK SOON!
data.text: Spring House is a coffee shop--not a dinner house--and it does exactly what it's supposed to do. Plenty of good food is served by cheerful waitresses and, something important to me, they make turkey sandwiches with the real "bird"; not some weird pressed meat. And the coleslaw is excellent. When I retired, I started going to restaurants that were closer to my house, so it's been quite a while since I've been to Spring House. After going two weeks ago, today made my third stop. I'm a happy camper!

data.title: Breakfast outing
data.text: I have been at this restaurant for lunch and dinner. Breakfast is good, nothing special. I have been for here for lunch before but not impressed with what I ate.

data.title: Microwaved food taste
data.text: Not good food... tasted microwaved. Fish and chips. Ugh. Omelet was"ok".  Not great service. Had to ask for refills. They were not busy. Pricey for restaurant whose food obviously wasn't homemade. . Our kids loved the train that ran around the ceiling but we had to ask for it to be turned on. Will not be going back.

data.title: Classic ambience
data.text: The food is not fancy but it is good and plentiful.  The waitresses wonderfully attentive and personable, right to the point of, but not doing so (alas?) of calling customers "Hon" in a homespun comfortable way.  The model train around the ceiling is great !   As a muralist myself, I wouldn't dream about touching the wonderful works that are on the walls, but I've seen and done better.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Great food, huge portions and very good prices. All day breakfast. Excellent and friendly service. Nice country diner atmosphere.

data.title: Breakfast Omelettes are always delicious
data.text: We go there for breakfast to get the omelette breakfast. It's big enough to be shared by two people.

data.title: Great Family Restaurant
data.text: Spring House offers a variety of food throughout the whole day. Large portions. They are also very accommodating. The ladies that serve the customers are friendly and constantly on the move. This place has a lot of regular customers and is very busy on Sunday mornings.

data.title: Great breakfast in town
data.text: I would recommend this place if your wanting a great breakfast in mid town. The train that runs threw the rim of the restrant is very  entertaining for all ages.

data.title: Good food, great service
data.text: Great service is very important to my family, and we always get it at Spring House. It's a quaint little restaurant with a nice atmosphere, even has a small train goes around the ceiling. Plenty of food!

data.title: Great value but run down
data.text: Spring House has great food for great prices. It used to have a running train around the entire store ceiling. Now its just an empty track. How very sad.

data.title: Real food, friendly staff, and great senior prices
data.text:
I ate here this afternoon, I was weary and stopped into my local cafe.  The parking lot was filled and the restaurant was doing great business. Lots of seniors and I sat at the counter. I have eaten here several times however, getting around the curve to get into the place sometimes deters me.
Sat at the counter and order the senior #1 choice. The waitress was pleasant and wow when I received my order after thinking that the customer next to me was robbing the place. (He had been eating and suddenly was at the cash register, I thought he was a robber). He was the owner, boy, I almost threw a glass of cold water at him... anyway, when I received my Senior Meal, it was HUGE.. my eggs were great, the home potatoes were good, not greasy or overcooked, bacon not burnt, and biscuit and gravy covered another plate.  This was enough for two.   This is an old establishment and local, and the patrons enjoy the place.  Its quiet, clean good food, great prices for the value.  Its not Dennys, nor Carrows or MImis, its a local establishment.  I believe the owner is new and has spruced up the outside some.  It reminds me of places in small towns in the Midwest.  I suggest trying it, it is about 5 miles off the freeway, however, it privately owned and the people who work there care.  Most of the other reviews are outdated.

data.title: good coffee shop fare
data.text: It's a cafe with good cafe food and decent prices. The Senor menu is very good. The service is friendly and quick.  remember this is a coffee shop without pretentions

data.title: Big omelets will feed two.
data.text: Average diner food. Nothing to write home about except their omelets are 6 egg omelets. Plenty to feed 2 adults. Other than that just So So.

data.title: Not worth 'springing off' I-15 to eat at this restaurant
data.text:
There are few choices along this stretch of I-15 near the Spring House Family Restaurant other than fast food which most people can tolerate along here due to the many available choi- ces, pressure of traffic and bodies tired of desert travel who usually just want to sit down and eat!  If you are adventurous like The Monk (that's me) you don't mind taking the old highway or the road into town to find that memorable Mom & Pop with the spe- cial pancakes or a favorite local dish.  

Located about 6 mi from the freeway, The Spring House seemed promising, with its full parking lot and a real home-town look and feel, rare along the over-signed and generally tacky Main St of Hesperia.  The entry area walls were covered with photos of smiling kids' soccer teams and plaques boasting of management's hosting of service clubs.  I liked that.

Service was fast and friendly.  The menu is huge, sort of the "Lucky Greek" style of a little bit of every- thing all American, with breakfast served anytime that is typical of Southern California mid-century Mom and Pop's.  Most of the clientele were seniors and apparent locals.  I doubt the Spring House caters much to tourists and freeway traffic.  The parking and rest rooms were satisfactory, however the entire property is becoming run down and needs paint and patching here and there.  But the dining area was still pretty clean.

My food was average, typical breakfast fare of eggs, pancakes and sausage.  I think the grapefruit juice was watered down, you know, those over-sugared "cocktail" disappointments.  Portion sizes for all were fine.  

Bottom line:  Don't waste your time 'springing off' the Interstate, fighting Main St traffic and garish advertising to visit the Spring House.  Its OK for locals and families not in a hurry but isn't quite worth the trouble to go out of your way for.

data.title: Please work on it!
data.text: I go to Spring House every so often, hoping that the food qualty has improved. When they first opened it was good, but over the years it just keeps getting worse! Service has always been fair to good and sometimes even great. But can't say that for the food. BUT, I never got sick!

data.title: love the place very nice people working there
data.text: i love going to the restaurant the are very nice people working there there are very nice cooks who make great food at night i thank wone name is sam and paco very nice cooks and dineo the manger is very kined and helpful ........... thank you every wone for makeing me happy...

data.title: I am sure that the "FREEZER" is well stocked!
data.text: While I completely understand that Spring House Restaurant is a popular diner in Hesperia, the food is a bit bland. I ordered a simple hamburger. My thinking was that a diner that is so loved by many people in the area that they would be able to create a great burger. I was wrong. The hamburger was good, but I could get a better one at fast food joint. The patty was from a frozen package, I was able to tell from the no taste and the seam line that was put from the production machine at the factory. I looked at the other plate within my group and saw that the breaded shrimp was also a once frozen product, created in some factory. So was he Malibu Chicken plate, with a slice of ham from a store package. Other items on our plates seem to be also from a production factory. It is sad to see that a diner like this can not get away from this type of food. If they had, a hamburger was 100% fresh and made by hand with some seasoning I would be will to pay the needed price for that type of food. There is so much great food that could come out of this restaurant.

data.title: Mediocre service and greasy food too on 2/5/10
data.text: waited 15 minutes before server even acknoledged that I was there, and then blamed it on the manager.  That was only the beginning of a bad experience, when the food got there it was very greasy.  The corned beef was swimming in grease as was the toast, the eggs however weren't bad, but the hash brown were like rubber.  Needless to say I couldn't finish the food.  The worst part is that after I left I had a burnt bacon taste in my mouth and didn't even have bacon with my breakfast.  It used to be a pretty good place to eat, but I won't be going back anytime soon.  The atmoshphere is good though.
